p: Zhou et al. [ 45] suggested, also, that β-caryophyllene could be used as a therapeutic target for the treatment of diabetic patients, since this terpene acts at the level of arginine-specific mono-ADP-ribosyltransferase 1. Moreover, β-caryophyllene oral administration at a dose of 200 mg/kg induced a reduction of glucose, increase of plasma insulin levels, and improvement of altered activities of carbohydrate metabolic enzymes [ 46].
